page.title: 19East & West Ayton
page.content: Twin villages separated by the River Derwent. Twenty years ago they were small agricultural villages,the farming nucleus has remained but house builders have developed both villages causing the population to increase fourfold. Many residents commute to Scarborough. The Norman church is in East Ayton.There are two chapels one in each village. The Victorian school has been extended to accommodate upwards of 200 children.There are four general stores a haberdashers,post office,butchers, fish and chip shop and two garages. The Doctors' surgery in Wes Ayton serves villages to the East and West of the village for several miles. There are four doctors. There is a recently opened Dental Practice.
